It is characterized by its slender, winding stems and small, elongated leaves that are typically covered in a smooth, glabrous surface. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical or subtropical forests. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a unique fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
